s0473.chinese: 思王立五月，少弟嵬攻殺思王而自立，是為考王。
s0473.literal: King Si ascended for five months, his youngest brother Wei attacked and killed King Si and established himself, this was King Kao.
s0473.idiomatic: King Si ascended for five months, his youngest brother Wei attacked and killed King Si and established himself, this was King Kao.

s0474.literal: These three kings were all sons of King Ding.
s0474.idiomatic: These three kings were all sons of King Ding.

s0475.chinese: 考王十五年，崩，子威烈王午立。
s0475.literal: King Kao's fifteenth year, he died, his son King Wei Lie Wu ascended.
s0475.idiomatic: King Kao's fifteenth year, he died, his son King Wei Lie Wu ascended.

s0476.chinese: 考王封其弟于河南，是為桓公，以續周公之官職。
s0476.literal: King Kao enfeoffed his younger brother in Henan, this was Duke Huan, to continue the Zhou Gong's official duties.
s0476.idiomatic: King Kao enfeoffed his younger brother in Henan, this was Duke Huan, to continue the Zhou Gong's official duties.

s0477.literal: Duke Huan died, his son Duke Wei succeeded.
s0477.idiomatic: Duke Huan died, his son Duke Wei succeeded.

s0478.chinese: 威公卒，子惠公代立，乃封其少子於鞏以奉王，號東周惠公。
s0478.literal: Duke Wei died, his son Duke Hui succeeded, then enfeoffed his youngest son at Gong to serve the king, styled Eastern Zhou Hui Gong.
s0478.idiomatic: Duke Wei died, his son Duke Hui succeeded, then enfeoffed his youngest son at Gong to serve the king, styled Eastern Zhou Hui Gong.

s0479.chinese: 威烈王二十三年，九鼎震。
s0479.literal: King Wei Lie's twenty-third year, the Nine Tripods shook.
s0479.idiomatic: King Wei Lie's twenty-third year, the Nine Tripods shook.

s0480.literal: Commanded Han, Wei, Zhao to be feudal lords.
s0480.idiomatic: Commanded Han, Wei, Zhao to be feudal lords.

s0481.chinese: 二十四年，崩，子安王驕立。
s0481.literal: Twenty-fourth year, he died, his son King An Jiao ascended.
s0481.idiomatic: Twenty-fourth year, he died, his son King An Jiao ascended.

s0482.literal: This year robbers killed Chu Sheng Wang.
s0482.idiomatic: This year robbers killed Chu Sheng Wang.

s0483.chinese: 安王立二十六年，崩，子烈王喜立。
s0483.literal: King An ascended for twenty-six years, died, his son King Lie Xi ascended.
s0483.idiomatic: King An ascended for twenty-six years, died, his son King Lie Xi ascended.

s0484.chinese: 烈王二年，周太史儋見秦獻公曰：「始周與秦國合而別，別五百載復合，合十七歲而霸王者出焉。」
s0484.literal: King Lie's second year, Zhou Grand Historian Dan saw Qin Xian Gong and said: 'Originally Zhou and Qin were united then separated, separated five hundred years then reunited, united seventeen years and a hegemon-king will emerge.'
s0484.idiomatic: King Lie's second year, Zhou Grand Historian Dan saw Qin Xian Gong and said: 'Originally Zhou and Qin were united then separated, separated five hundred years then reunited, united seventeen years and a hegemon-king will emerge.'

s0486.chinese: 十年，烈王崩，弟扁立，是為顯王。
s0486.literal: Tenth year, King Lie died, his younger brother Bian ascended, this was King Xian.
s0486.idiomatic: Tenth year, King Lie died, his younger brother Bian ascended, this was King Xian.

s0487.chinese: 顯王五年，賀秦獻公，獻公稱伯。
s0487.literal: King Xian's fifth year, congratulated Qin Xian Gong, Xian Gong was styled hegemon.
s0487.idiomatic: King Xian's fifth year, congratulated Qin Xian Gong, Xian Gong was styled hegemon.

s0488.chinese: 九年，致文武胙於秦孝公。
s0488.literal: Ninth year, sent the sacrifices of Wen and Wu to Qin Xiao Gong.
s0488.idiomatic: Ninth year, sent the sacrifices of Wen and Wu to Qin Xiao Gong.

s0489.chinese: 二十五年，秦會諸侯於周。
s0489.literal: Twenty-fifth year, Qin assembled the feudal lords at Zhou.
s0489.idiomatic: Twenty-fifth year, Qin assembled the feudal lords at Zhou.

s0490.chinese: 二十六年，周致伯於秦孝公。
s0490.literal: Twenty-sixth year, Zhou granted the title of hegemon to Qin Xiao Gong.
s0490.idiomatic: Twenty-sixth year, Zhou granted the title of hegemon to Qin Xiao Gong.

s0491.literal: Thirty-third year, congratulated Qin Hui Wang.
s0491.idiomatic: Thirty-third year, congratulated Qin Hui Wang.

s0492.chinese: 三十五年，致文武胙於秦惠王。
s0492.literal: Thirty-fifth year, sent the sacrifices of Wen and Wu to Qin Hui Wang.
s0492.idiomatic: Thirty-fifth year, sent the sacrifices of Wen and Wu to Qin Hui Wang.

s0493.literal: Forty-fourth year, Qin Hui Wang styled himself king.
s0493.idiomatic: Forty-fourth year, Qin Hui Wang styled himself king.

s0494.literal: Twenty-ninth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0495.chinese: 四十八年，顯王崩，子慎靚王定立。
s0495.literal: Thirty-first year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0496.chinese: 慎靚王立六年，崩，子赧王延立。
s0496.literal: Thirty-third year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0497.literal: Thirty-fifth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0498.literal: Thirty-seventh year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0499.chinese: 西周武公之共太子死，有五庶子，毋適立。
s0499.literal: Thirty-ninth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0500.chinese: 司馬翦謂楚王曰：「不如以地資公子咎，為請太子。」
s0500.literal: Forty-first year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0501.literal: Forty-third year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0502.chinese: 周不聽，是公之知困而交疏於周也。
s0502.literal: Forty-fifth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0503.chinese: 不如請周君孰欲立，以微告翦，翦請令楚（賀）［資］之以地。」
s0503.literal: Forty-seventh year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0504.literal: Forty-eighth year, Xian Wang died, his son Shenjing Wang ascended.

s0505.literal: Shenjing Wang first year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0506.chinese: 而楚以周為秦故，將伐之。
s0506.literal: Second year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0507.chinese: 蘇代為周說楚王曰：「何以周為秦之禍也？
s0507.literal: Third year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0508.chinese: 言周之為秦甚於楚者，欲令周入秦也，故謂『周秦』也。
s0508.literal: Fourth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0509.chinese: 周知其不可解，必入於秦，此為秦取周之精者也。
s0509.literal: Fifth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0510.chinese: 為王計者，周於秦因善之，不於秦亦言善之，以疏之於秦。
s0510.literal: Sixth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0511.literal: Seventh year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0513.chinese: 秦借道兩周之閒，將以伐韓，周恐借之畏於韓，不借畏於秦。
s0513.literal: Eighth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0514.chinese: 史厭謂周君曰：「何不令人謂韓公叔曰『秦之敢絕周而伐韓者，信東周也。
s0514.literal: Ninth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0515.chinese: 公何不與周地，發質使之楚』？
s0515.literal: Tenth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0516.chinese: 秦必疑楚不信周，是韓不伐也。
s0516.literal: Eleventh year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0517.chinese: 又謂秦曰『韓彊與周地，將以疑周於秦也，周不敢不受』。
s0517.literal: Twelfth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0518.chinese: 秦必無辭而令周不受，是受地於韓而聽於秦。」
s0518.literal: Thirteenth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0520.chinese: 秦召西周君，西周君惡往，故令人謂韓王曰：「秦召西周君，將以使攻王之南陽也，王何不出兵於南陽？
s0520.literal: Fourteenth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0521.literal: Fifteenth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0522.chinese: 周君不入秦，秦必不敢踰河而攻南陽矣。」
s0522.literal: Sixteenth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0524.chinese: 東周與西周戰，韓救西周。
s0524.literal: Seventeenth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0525.chinese: 或為東周說韓王曰：「西周故天子之國，多名器重寶。
s0525.literal: Eighteenth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.

s0526.chinese: 王案兵毋出，可以德東周，而西周之寶必可以盡矣。」
s0526.literal: Nineteenth year, solar eclipse, did not record the day, the officials lost it.
